translation: I offer thanks to You, living and eternal Sovereign, for You have mercifully restored my soul within me; great is Your faithfulness.
notes: First words upon waking, expressing gratitude for a new day.

hebrew: בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה יְיָ אֱלֹהֵינוּ מֶלֶךְ הָעוֹלָם אֲשֶׁר קִדְּשָׁנוּ בְּמִצְוֹתָיו וְצִוָּנוּ עַל נְטִילַת יָדַיִם.
translitAshkenazi: Baruch atah Adonai Eloheinu Melekh ha'olam asher kid'shanu b'mitzvosav v'tzivanu al n'tilas yadayim.
translitSephardi: Baruch ata Adonai Eloheinu Melech ha'olam asher kid'shanu b'mitzvotav v'tzivanu al netilat yadayim.
translation: Blessed are You, Adonai our God, Sovereign of the universe, who has sanctified us with commandments and commanded us concerning the washing of the hands.
notes: Said when washing hands upon rising.

hebrew:
בָּרוּךְ... פּוֹקֵחַ עִוְרִים
בָּרוּךְ... מַלְבִּישׁ עֲרוּמִים
בָּרוּךְ... הַמֵּכִין מִצְעֲדֵי גָבֶר
translitAshkenazi: Baruch... pokeach ivrim / malbish arumim / hamechin mitz'adei gaver
translitSephardi: Baruch... pokeach ivrim / malbish arumim / hamechin mits'adei gaver
translation: Blessed... who opens the eyes of the blind; ...who clothes the naked; ...who steadies our steps.
notes: Morning blessings of gratitude for daily abilities.

hebrew: שְׁמַע יִשְׂרָאֵל יְיָ אֱלֹהֵינוּ יְיָ אֶחָד...
translitAshkenazi: Shema Yisrael Adonai Eloheinu Adonai echad...
translitSephardi: Shema Yisrael Adonai Eloheinu Adonai echad...
translation: Hear, O Israel: Adonai is our God, Adonai is One...
notes: Affirmation of God's unity; traditionally recited morning and night.

translation: If you surely heed My commandments...
notes: Second paragraph of the Shema, focusing on living Torah daily.

translation: The standing prayer with blessings of praise, petitions, and gratitude.
notes: Structure: 3 opening praises, 13 requests, 3 closing thanks. Take three steps forward/back.

translation: Afternoon Amidah with the same core blessings as morning; add supplication.
notes: Short, mindful pause mid-day; face Jerusalem if possible.

translation: Evening Amidah, adding Hashkiveinu prayer for peaceful rest.
notes: Many communities add 'Peace' themes at night; consult your rabbi for local custom.

translation: Recite the Shema upon your bed...
notes: Invite calm, reflect on the day, release grudges before sleep.
